ygData.subject: Re: [EQ_Potters] Digest Number 20
ygData.msgSnippet: ... From: Brandon Purrington  To: EQ_Potters@onelist.com  Date: Friday, July 09, 1999 8:45 AM Subject: Re:
ygData.messageBody:
-----Original Message-----
From: Brandon Purrington <mbmcenterprises@...>
To: EQ_Potters@onelist.com <EQ_Potters@onelist.com>
Date: Friday, July 09, 1999 8:45 AM
Subject: Re: [EQ_Potters] Digest Number 20


>From: "Brandon Purrington" <mbmcenterprises@...>
>
>Hi all.
>
>I have been monitoring for awhile now and have been making pie tins. I have
>my skill up to almost 100 now and am wondering a couple things:
>First of all, what does the Diety sketch do.
>Second, I have seen magical clay statues - how are these made? It HAS to be
>with pottery, they are clay. Anyone know about updates for new enchanter
>spells???
>Third, How far will pie tins get me? I know that I am making some pretty
>good money at it but what can I do to REALLY make money? I hear of people
>making 30+ plat an hour of doing it, but what are you making? Any details
>will be appreciated and a list of when things become trivial would help to!
>
>Thanks guys!!!
>May pottery live on forever!
>


Here's how I make 30 plat an hour in Freeport
I now have a skill of 120 something, (where mixing
bowls become trivial) but these numbers were done
@ a skill of 115 (where pie tins become trivial)
with a Cha of 90 I pay

4s2c Block of Clay
4s2c Block of Clay
1s1c Sketch (pie tin)
1s1c Water
--------
8s6c per unfired bowl attempt.

with a success rate of 80.3 % at 115 ( this is over 158 attempts)
you get a cost per unfired bowl of
1/.803 * 8.6 = 10s1c per unfired bowl

10s1c per unfired bowl
4s2c per High Quality Firing Sheet
--------
14s3c per fired tin attempt

with a success rate of 96.1%

1/.961 * 14.3 = 14s9c cost per pie tin

I then sell them for 6g3s (63s)
(this was to alec greenglade, but
I discovered I get 6g5s at Galio in
the in next to the wheel)

63s - 15s =48s or 4.8g per pie tin for profit.
(Now I have a higher success + higher resale
so it's probably 5.1 or better)

I make a single run to Merra Clayfinger to
start off the session, and buy 64 firing sheets.

That minimizes the number of times I have to
make the 2 zone run for firing sheets.

for each of these sessions then I average about
30pp profit.
(a bit more now)

I takes just over an hour to use up the 64 firing
sheets, plus however long I have to sit and wait
for someone at the wheel
